title: I cannot access my bank's website in Firefoc
content:
Hello,

I have been using Firefox as my daily internet browser for almost a decade now. Now, beginning 2022, I cannot access this webpage https://www.bdo.com.ph. Not sure why but, I was able to access this website last December 2021. I also tried accessing my other bank's website and all are working fine. Is this problem only specific to this website or is it related to the latest updates by Firefox?

I've already tried disabling all my add-ons, extensions, and my internet security extension in Firefox, but to no avail. Note that I'm using Firefox 97.0.1 and my internet security suite is Kaspersky.

Appreciate your tips on how to resolve this issue.
creator: pjbersamina

title: firefox blocks browser based zoom access to laptop speakers
content: When joining a Zoom meeting hosted on the browser rather than installed Zoom app, my speakers are not working and the troubleshooting error messages says the browser is blocking zoom from accessing the speakers. I can't find a setting in Firefox preferences to block/allow it. Speakers work on YouTube/Vimeo with no problems (speaker volume 100% and not muted). Speakers had been working with Zoom until a couple weeks ago. I don't want to install the Zoom app just because Google hates privacy and and I don't want to help them own my privacy anymore than I must. I use DuckDuckGo for the default search engine, have Ghostery for an Extension/add-on, and have the Firefox browser set for private window always. I have tried various cookie settings for the Zoom meetings and even the dreaded "accept all cookies" and have Firefox cookie handling set to Standard, with deleting all cookies and history upon exit. I am on 64-bit Windows 10 up to date as of 2/16/22, Dell computer updated to same date, and latest update of Firefox 2/18/22. I have done a number of web searches and not finding the speaker topic or error message other than three unanswered help requests from others with the same problem dated from July-Sept 2021.
creator: jn9olvr

title: Cannot SEND e-mails - Blocked, "Reply-To address is not validated."
content: I cannot SEND e-mails. Warning says :"Reply-To address is not validated." How do I correct that problem ?
creator: playercn

title: Firefox updates do not restore tabs correctly
content:
• iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, 2017), macOS Mojave 10.14.6, Firefox 97.0.1 ***

After relaunching Firefox following the last several Firefox updates, the tabs on my frontmost window no longer reflect the set of tabs that had been there previously. Instead, they appear to have come from weeks to months ago, obliterating quite a lot of work.
creator: jfrench1

content: Con la última actualización a 97.0.1, no deja entrar a la banca en línea de BBVA porque dice que no tiene permitida la ubicación cuando justo le di aceptar e incluso que se guardara esa decisión :S

title: how do I save passwords in firefox
content:
a simple question but I cannot find help.

How do I save passwords in foxfire 97.0.1 for windows 11. I want to keep them only on my desktop computer.
creator: hjacobs1

title: Why is Google SERP dark mode now black instead of gray?
content: I'm using dark mode for Google and it worked fine until recently when suddenly the SERP appeared in black rather than gray. I have already tried changing the layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override setting to 2 but it didn't have any effect. I have included screenshots of Firefox and Chrome where you can clearly see the difference in color. The black background is very uncomfortable and I need to change it back to the gray color like in Chrome. How?
creator: susccy

title: Touch Keyboard Crashing/Closing Win11 Surface Pro 7
content: Been having issues with the touch keyboard for a while now, the only work around I have is disabling the Autohide feature for the taskbar. Firefox still hiccups, but the touch keyboard will activate. Crashes in all other circumstances. I've noticed this bug around for a while, is there a way I can get around this without messing with my taskbar?
creator: cobalt583

title: Printing PDF files in Firefox 97 adds extra margins
content: After release 97 was installed, my PDF tax files no longer print correctly because an extra margin gets added top, left, right, and bottom. It is visible in the preview, and that's the way it prints. Nowhere can I find a margin adjustment. What is even stranger is that this only happens with "fillable" tax files which I downloaded from IRS and filled in with Firefox, some in release 96 and some in 97. In release 96 they printed correctly, but not in release 97. Do I need to use a different browser?
creator: werner42graf

title: FireFox showing a blank page for Facebook
content: Whenever I go to Facebook website, the Facebook page goes totally blank. It's happening for a few days now... Facebook is working fine in Chrome without a glitch. It's extremely frustrating. Feel like ditching my beloved browser. Please advice. thanks
creator: amanpartaps

title: Netflix broken once I log on to Firefox Sync?
content:
I have confirmed logging onto Firefox Sync does indeed break Netflix for me. I just was not so sure until now...

Details: I've gone a couple weeks without syncing and had no issues with any websites; watched lots of Netflix too.

After today's upgrade to FF97, I decided to risk it and log back onto Sync. Right away Netflix was broken in its tab, with "Pardon the Interruption. This title is not available to be watched instantly. Please try another title. -1044" and then "Error Code F7121 - 1331"

I have received this error code and more other similar ones from Netflix back a few weeks ago when I was actively troubleshooting this glitch. None of the fixes worked, and the ones that involved sifting through many dozens of about:config settings were avoided.

Thing is, back then, I made no changes I can surely recall, except upgrading to FF 96. OK, maybe some others...

And what's happening to my Netflix tab is not happening to any other tabs/sites, now or before; just Netflix.

I'm hoping someone here has seen this same thing happen and can shed some light on why my FF synced login breaks Netflix but when I'm not logged in, Netflix is ok.

Thanks;
creator: mkwritch

title: Thunderbird files
content: I am getting rid of this laptop, purging everything and selling it. There are certain Thunderbird email files I want to keep off on a DVD, but I can't find them except by opening Thunderbird. I know they are stored somewhere in this laptop, and I'd like to simply take them off as an open file. So my question is, what is the file extension I need to look for -- e.g., *.eml or what? Thanks in advance.
creator: yzoldowl
